elements.title: Maria de Knuijt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to scholarship published in 2023, Maria de Knuijt, rather than her husband, was actually the main patron of Dutch painter Johannes Vermeer (work pictured)?

elements.title: Winchester United Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Winchester United Church, a place of worship in the City of Winchester District, Hampshire, was built into the walls of the former county jail?

elements.title: 2023 Tour Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kyren Wilson won the first four frames in all of his matches at the 2023 Tour Championship?

elements.title: a 2020 ballot initiative (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that supporters of a 2020 ballot initiative to expand Medicaid in Missouri did not use the words "Medicaid expansion" to describe their proposal in some campaign material?

elements.title: Marios Georgiou (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2022 Marios Georgiou became Cyprus's first European champion in gymnastics?

elements.title: 2021 College Football Playoff National Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in winning the 2021 College Football Playoff National Championship, Alabama head coach Nick Saban broke the record for the most Division I college football national championships as a coach?

elements.title: Chadd Cumberbatch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chadd Cumberbatch, a Montserratian poet and playwright, wrote a play called 1768 to tell the story of the island's St Patrick's Day slave rebellion?

elements.title: CT Special Forces: Back to Hell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the developers of CT Special Forces: Back to Hell responded to criticism of their previous game's password save system by making even more detailed passwords?
